maml:description.maml:para: Generates a data model for ingest by PushMetrics
Using a sample device or list of Datasources, will generate a model that can be replayed for simulated device activity by Submit-LMDataModel
An Array of Datasources to model, only used if not modeling a specific device.
Include graph configuration data in generated model.
Include alert threshold configuration data in generated model.
If generating a model based on a datasource, enable instance generation
How many instances to generate when using GenerateInstances command, defaults to 1 if not set
Simulation type to generate for the model. Currently not used will be worked on in the future
HostName of the mock device that is generated by the model.
DisplayName of the mock device that is generated by the model.

Path to export the HTML report to

maml:description.maml:para: This function retrieves a session from Logic Monitor.
The Get-LMSession function uses the account name provided to retrieve a session from Logic Monitor. It uses a secret API key stored in a vault to authenticate the request.
The name of the account for which the session details are to be retrieved. This is a mandatory parameter.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the account for which the session details are to be retrieved. This is a mandatory parameter.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.String. You can pipe a string that contains the account name to Get-LMSession.
The function returns the response from the Invoke-RestMethod cmdlet, which contains the session details.

maml:alert.maml:para: The function throws an error if it fails to retrieve the session details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command retrieves the session details for the account named "Account1".

maml:description.maml:para: Imports a Meraki Cloud portal into LM.
Imports a Meraki Cloud portal into LM along with creating any required groups and device properties.
Meraki Dashboard API Token
Array of Org Ids that you would like to import, if omitted all Org Ids will be imported
Array of Network Ids that you would like to import, if omitted all NetworkIds Ids will be imported
The main folder name for the Meraki import, if omitted the default name is Meraki
The parent group id that the root meraki device group should exist under, if omitted will default to root of resource tree
The collector id number to assign to created devices, if omitted devices will be assigned the first collector returned from Get-LMCollector
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Meraki Dashboard API Token
List out the available org ids for a given Meraki Portal. Useful if you want to use the AllowedOrgIds filter but dont know the id/names of the orgs
{{ Fill ListSNMPInfo Description }}
{{ Fill ListNetworkIds Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Meraki Dashboard API Token
Array of Org Ids that you would like to import, if omitted all Org Ids will be imported
Array of Network Ids that you would like to import, if omitted all NetworkIds Ids will be imported
The main folder name for the Meraki import, if omitted the default name is Meraki
The parent group id that the root meraki device group should exist under, if omitted will default to root of resource tree
The collector id number to assign to created devices, if omitted devices will be assigned the first collector returned from Get-LMCollector
List out the available org ids for a given Meraki Portal. Useful if you want to use the AllowedOrgIds filter but dont know the id/names of the orgs
{{ Fill ListSNMPInfo Description }}
{{ Fill ListNetworkIds Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:description.maml:para: This function initializes the Logic Monitor (POV) setup for SEs by automating various tasks required during POV setup.

The Initialize-LMPOVSetup function sets up various components of the Logic Monitor POV. It can set up the website, portal metrics, alert analysis, and LM container. The setup for each component can be controlled individually or all at once.
The name of the website to be set up. This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The HTTP type of the website. Defaults to "https". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The username for the Portal Metrics API. Defaults to "lm_portal_metrics". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The username for the Logs API. Defaults to "lm_logs". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
A switch to control the setup of the website. This parameter is used in the 'Individual' parameter set.
A switch to control the setup of the portal metrics. This parameter is used in the 'Individual' parameter set.
A switch to control the setup of the alert analysis. This parameter is used in the 'Individual' parameter set.
A switch to control the setup of the LM container. This parameter is used in the 'Individual' parameter set.
The username for the LM Container API. Defaults to "lm_container". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
{{ Fill MoveMinimalMonitoring Description }}
{{ Fill CleanupDynamicGroups Description }}
{{ Fill SetupWindowsLMLogs Description }}
{{ Fill IncludeDefaults Description }}
{{ Fill SetupCollectorServiceInsight Description }}
{{ Fill WindowsLMLogsEventChannels Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the website to be set up. This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The HTTP type of the website. Defaults to "https". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The username for the Portal Metrics API. Defaults to "lm_portal_metrics". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The username for the Logs API. Defaults to "lm_logs". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
The username for the LM Container API. Defaults to "lm_container". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.
{{ Fill IncludeDefaults Description }}
{{ Fill WindowsLMLogsEventChannels Description }}
{{ Fill RunAll Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill ReadOnlyMode Description }}

{{ Fill RevertReadOnlyMode Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

The username for the Logs API. Defaults to "lm_logs". This parameter is used in both 'All' and 'Individual' parameter sets.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes Submit-LMDataModel for an array of models

Based on the specified ModelPath, all discovered models are submitted to Submit-LMDataModel. ModelPath should contain a subfolder called Models which contains the generated model JSON files and additionally a Scipts folder with an pre processing scripts you want executed priot to model submission.
Logic Monitor bearer token for connecting to the targeted portal
LogicMontior Portal to submit models to
File path where models are located
Submitted Logs will have a log source name appended as metadata, defaults to PMv1 if not set
{{ Fill DatasourceSuffix Description }}
File name to use for transcript files, defaults to Runner.txt if not set
Switch to enable logging of submission results to LogicMonitor. If not set no logs will be generated.
Hashtable containing the required mapping info for lm logs.
{{ Fill LogAdditionalMetadata Description }}
Number of models to process in parallel, defaults to 5. Running too many concurrently can result in 429 errors.
{{ Fill MultiThreadDatasourceSubmission Description }}
Switch to enable the procesing of scripts included in the module directory under the script folder.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Logic Monitor bearer token for connecting to the targeted portal
LogicMontior Portal to submit models to
File path where models are located
Submitted Logs will have a log source name appended as metadata, defaults to PMv1 if not set
{{ Fill DatasourceSuffix Description }}
File name to use for transcript files, defaults to Runner.txt if not set
Switch to enable logging of submission results to LogicMonitor. If not set no logs will be generated.
Hashtable containing the required mapping info for lm logs.
{{ Fill LogAdditionalMetadata Description }}
Number of models to process in parallel, defaults to 5. Running too many concurrently can result in 429 errors.
{{ Fill MultiThreadDatasourceSubmission Description }}
Switch to enable the procesing of scripts included in the module directory under the script folder.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:description.maml:para: This function invokes a keep-alive signal for Logic Monitor Push Metrics.

The Invoke-LMPushMetricKeepAlive function sends a keep-alive signal to a device using Logic Monitor's Push Metrics. It uses a device object passed as a parameter and has default values for various other parameters related to the datasource and datapoint.
The device object for which the keep-alive signal is to be sent. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The name of the datasource group. Defaults to "Host Status".
The name of the datasource. Defaults to "PushMetricKeepAlive_PMv1".
The display name of the datasource. Defaults to "PushMetric Keep Alive".
The name of the instance. Defaults to "PushMetric_Keep_Alive".
The name of the datapoint. Defaults to "KeepAlive".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The device object for which the keep-alive signal is to be sent. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The name of the datasource group. Defaults to "Host Status".
The name of the datasource. Defaults to "PushMetricKeepAlive_PMv1".
The display name of the datasource. Defaults to "PushMetric Keep Alive".
The name of the instance. Defaults to "PushMetric_Keep_Alive".
The name of the datapoint. Defaults to "KeepAlive".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: PSCustomObject. You can pipe a device object to Invoke-LMPushMetricKeepAlive.
The function does not return any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: The function throws an error if it fails to send the keep-alive signal.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sends a keep-alive signal to the device represented by the $Device object.

maml:description.maml:para: This function renames Logic Monitor devices based on a specified property.

The Rename-LMDevicesFromProperty function renames devices in Logic Monitor based on a specified property. The property can be a system property, a custom property, or an auto property. The function uses the Set-LMDevice cmdlet to rename the devices.
The device or devices to be renamed. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The property based on which the devices are to be renamed. Defaults to "system.sysname".
The type of the property. Can be "system", "custom", or "auto". Defaults to "system".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The device or devices to be renamed. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The property based on which the devices are to be renamed. Defaults to "system.sysname".
The type of the property. Can be "system", "custom", or "auto". Defaults to "system".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.Object[]. You can pipe a device or an array of devices to Rename-LMDevicesFromProperty.
The function does not return any output. It displays a message for each device that is renamed or skipped.

maml:alert.maml:para: The function throws an error if it fails to rename a device.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames the device represented by the $Device object based on the system property "system.hostname".

maml:description.maml:para: This function searches for a specified pattern in the configuration backups of Logic Monitor devices.

The Search-LMDeviceConfigBackup function takes an array of configuration backups and a search pattern as input. It searches for the pattern in the configuration content of each device and returns the results.
An array of configuration backups for the devices. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The pattern to search for in the configuration backups. This is a mandatory parameter.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
An array of configuration backups for the devices. This is a mandatory parameter and can be piped to the function.
The pattern to search for in the configuration backups. This is a mandatory parameter.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.Object[]. You can pipe an array of configuration backups to Search-LMDeviceConfigBackup.
The function returns an array of custom objects. Each object represents a search result and contains the device display name,
the device poll timestamp in UTC, the device instance name, the configuration version, the line number where the match was found,
and the content of the match. If no match is found for a device, the line number and content are set to "No Match".

maml:alert.maml:para: The function writes a message to the host for each device, indicating the number of search results found.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command searches for the pattern "hostname" in the configuration backups represented by the $ConfigBackups array.

maml:description.maml:para: This function sets the data model for a Logic Monitor device.

The Set-LMDataModel function takes a model object and optional parameters for properties, hostname, display name, and simulation type. It modifies the model object based on the provided parameters and sets the data model for the device.

The model object to be modified. This is a mandatory parameter. The object must be a valid JSON object and must contain the properties "Datasources", "Properties", "DisplayName", "HostName", and "SimulationType".
A hashtable of properties to be added to the model object.
The hostname to be set in the model object.
The display name to be set in the model object.
The simulation type to be set in the model object. Can be "8to5", "random", "replication", or "replay_model".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

The model object to be modified. This is a mandatory parameter. The object must be a valid JSON object and must contain the properties "Datasources", "Properties", "DisplayName", "HostName", and "SimulationType".
A hashtable of properties to be added to the model object.
The hostname to be set in the model object.
The display name to be set in the model object.
The simulation type to be set in the model object. Can be "8to5", "random", "replication", or "replay_model".
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: System.Object. You can pipe a model object to Set-LMDataModel.
The function reutrns an updated model object

maml:alert.maml:para: The function throws an error if the model object is not a valid JSON object or if it does not contain the required properties.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command modifies the model object represented by the $Model variable, setting the hostname to "NewHostname", the display name to "NewDisplayName", and the simulation type to "random".

maml:description.maml:para: This function starts a session synchronization server for Logic Monitor.

The Start-LMSessionSyncServer function starts a Pode server that is used to synchronize sessions for Logic Monitor. It uses a secret vault to store session details. If the vault does not exist, it creates one. The function also provides options to enable request logging and error logging.
A switch to control whether request logging is enabled.
A switch to control whether error logging is enabled.
A switch to control whether request logging is enabled.
A switch to control whether error logging is enabled.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Start-LMSessionSyncServer.
The function does not return any output. It writes messages to the host to indicate the status of the server and the secret vault.

maml:alert.maml:para: The function throws an error if it fails to unlock the secret vault with the provided credentials.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the session synchronization server with request logging and error logging enabled.
